briefdescription.para: today's date.
earliest allowed date
latest allowed date
whether the given year is a leap one
first day of the month to which the given date belongs
whether a date is the first day of its month
last day of the month to which the given date belongs
whether a date is the last day of its month
next given weekday following or equal to the given date

detaileddescription.para: E.g., the Friday following Tuesday, January 15th, 2002 was January 18th, 2002.

memberdef.argsstring: (Size n, Weekday w, Month m, Year y)
memberdef.name: nthWeekday

briefdescription.para: n-th given weekday in the given month and year

detaileddescription.para: E.g., the 4th Thursday of March, 1998 was March 26th, 1998.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor returning a null date.
Constructor taking a serial number as given by Applix or Excel.
More traditional constructor.
One-based (Jan 1st = 1)
increments date by the given number of days
increments date by the given period
decrement date by the given number of days
decrements date by the given period

1-day post-increment

returns a new date incremented by the given period

serial number type
Difference in days between dates.
Difference in days (including fraction of days) between dates.

detaileddescription.para: Compute a hash value of d.
This method makes Date hashable via boost::hash.

briefdescription.para: Concrete date class.

detaileddescription.para: This class provides methods to inspect dates as well as methods and operators which implement a limited date algebra (increasing and decreasing dates, and calculating their difference).

xrefdescription.para: self-consistency of dates, serial numbers, days of month, months, and weekdays is checked over the whole date range.
